title.narrative: Création des pages Web de l'IRCAAA

description.narrative: The Collaborative Adaptation Research Initiative in Africa and Asia (CARIAA) generates and shares new knowledge on vulnerability and adaptation within and across three climate change hotspots: semi-arid regions, deltas, and glacier- and snowpack-dependent river basins. This project will share that knowledge through a program website. IDRC and the UK's Department for International Development jointly fund CARIAA. This multi-regional and interdisciplinary program supports high-calibre research and policy engagement through a network of research consortia. This collaborative research model involves a wide range of partnerships between program donors and consortia member institutions. Sharing knowledge can be a challenge. The CARIAA website will bring coherence to their work. It will also offer a clear program identity, along with links to results and consortia news. CARIAA's target audiences include researchers, policymakers, and climate and development practitioners, particularly those working in hotspot regions. Our approach to communicating research does not involve building research repositories. Instead, our focus is to get research results into the most relevant spaces for knowledge-sharing. The proposed independent, co-branded Web space will do that. It will build on information available through IDRC's corporate website and archival systems, such as the IDRC Digital Library. Design specifications will include: -user-informed design; -easy for content developers to use; -emphasis on showcasing results, including strong storytelling; -bilingual interface; and, -metrics monitoring (visitors, resources accessed and shared, etc.) IDRC staff will manage the site's main program-level page(s), which will link to pages where consortia can feature their own content. Ideally, designated consortium team members will be able to generate content for these pages, which IDRC staff will check for quality, translate, and publish. IDRC will provide training support to CARIAA team members on how to manage and update the site. The site will link to items and documents available on the IDRC website and in the IDRC Digital Library to ensure that it does not duplicate existing systems. IDRC will also develop a governance document outlining management practices for the website.
